sen.j: 石川 家光（いしかわ いえみつ、生年不詳 - 元徳2年4月2日 (旧暦)（1330年4月20日））は、鎌倉時代の武将。
sen.e: Iemitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - April 20, 1330) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Kamakura period.
Iemitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - April 28, 1330) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。
sen.e: Iemitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - April 28, 1330) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 大和源氏の流れを汲む陸奥石川氏12代目当主。
sen.e: He is the twentieth family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan, which was derived from the Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He is the twentieth family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan, which was derived from the Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He is the twentieth family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan, which was derived from the Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He is the eldest son of Moriyoshi ISHIKAWA.
He is the oldest son of Moriyoshi ISHIKAWA.
He is the oldest son of Moriyoshi ISHIKAWA.
He is the father of Sadamitsu ISHIKAWA and others.
He is the father of Sadamitsu ISHIKAWA and others.
He is the father of Sadamitsu ISHIKAWA and others.

sen.j: 従五位下駿河守、従四位下摂津守。
sen.e: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suruga no kami (the governor of Suruga Province) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Settsu no kami (the governor of Settsu Province)
Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suruga no kami (the governor of Suruga Province) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Settsu no kami (the governor of Settsu Province)
Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suruga no kami (the governor of Suruga Province) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Settsu no kami (the governor of Settsu Province)
His wife is a daughter of Yoshinari TATARA.
His wife is a daughter of Yoshinari TATARA.
His wife is a daughter of Yoshinari TATARA.

sen.j: 文保2年（1318年）12月、鎌倉に赴き執権北条高時に面会、将軍守邦親王に拝謁。
sen.e: He went to Kamakura to see the regent Takatoki HOJO in December, 1318, and had an audience with the shogun Imperial Prince Morikuni.
He went to Kamakura to see the regent Takatoki HOJO in December, 1318, and had an audience with the shogun Imperial Prince Morikuni.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He went to Kamakura to see the regent Takatoki HOJO in December, 1318, and had an audience with the shogun Imperial Prince Morikuni.

sen.j: 上洛して従五位下駿河守に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He went to Kyoto, where he was appointed to Jugoinoge, Suruga no kami.
He went to Kyoto, where he was appointed to Jugoinoge, Suruga no kami.
He went to Kyoto, where he was appointed to Jugoinoge, Suruga no kami.

sen.j: 正中 (元号)2年（1325年）5月、弟家隆を引き連れて上洛し、家光は従四位下摂津守、家隆は従五位下山城守に任じられる。
sen.e: In May, 1325, he went to Kyoto with his younger brother Ietaka, where he was appointed to Jushiinoge, Settsu no kami, and his brother to Jugoinoge, Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province).
In May, 1325, he went to Kyoto with his younger brother Ietaka, where he was appointed to Jushiinoge, Settsu no kami, and his brother to Jugoinoge, Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province).
In May, 1325, he went to Kyoto with his younger brother Ietaka, where he was appointed to Jushiinoge, Settsu no kami, and his brother to Jugoinoge, Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province).
